pr_title: [ML] reduce InferenceProcessor.Factory log spam by not parsing pipelines

timeline.message: [ML] reduce InfereceProcessor.Factory log spam by not parsing pipelines

timeline.bodyText:
++ on this approach to getting a count of inference processors. It should fit more nicely into the ingest pipeline initialization process and be lighter weight than fully instantiating each pipeline.
One thing you might consider is that the config map for an ingest pipeline is a tree structure in which some nodes such as ForEach processors may contain child nodes. I do not know how inference processors are typically configured, but the code above will count them only if they're at the top level of the pipeline tree.
timeline.author: danhermann

replies.bodyText: @danhermann good point...I will have to traverse the tree.
replies.author: benwtrent

timeline.author: danhermann

replies.bodyText: This would require adding the ingest-common module as a dependency to the ML plugin. Did not want to do that for a single string :/
replies.author: benwtrent

replies.bodyText: Ah, right. Definitely not worth it for a string.
replies.author: danhermann

timeline.bodyText: The for-each processor and the onFailure directive are the only scenarios I know of that result in child processors. Both of those can be nested to an indefinite number of levels. I'm not sure how far you want to go down that rabbit hole, though.
timeline.author: danhermann

replies.bodyText:
Yeesh, yeah, thats right.
Ugh, I will do the recursion. But who on earth would have a foreach processor nested in a foreach processor :(
replies.author: benwtrent

replies.bodyText: Only allow recursion up to 10 layers. Handling on_failure and foreach. seems to work ok :D
replies.author: benwtrent

replies.bodyText: Looks good to me. Thanks for making that change.
replies.author: danhermann

timeline.author: davidkyle

timeline.bodyText: foreach can only have 1 processor so there is no need to iterate here.
timeline.author: davidkyle

replies.bodyText: The iteration is just for simplicity. Otherwise I will have assert size is == 1 and then get first entry, etc. Iteration here is cleaner IMO.
replies.author: benwtrent

replies.bodyText:
👍
It threw me because it is called the foreach processor and it looks like a misunderstanding, perhaps leave a comment
replies.author: davidkyle
